data.title: Coffee and Breakfast
data.text: A Saturday morning and Manaia Coffee is a great combination. I am not a fan of sugared up coffees so I get fresh brewed. They offer creamer and I carry stevia to use. But the breakfast choices are good. They have gluten free options too! 🎉 I checked the menu out online and found they have a burrito in a bowl for those who are gf. So I went in intending to order that but found out the biscuits are gf too! I ended up with a great breakfast biscuit of eggs, cheese and bacon. My hubby and I have already gone back a second time.

data.title: Great breakfast burritos
data.text: I have had the veggie breakfast burrito here a few times and it is delicious.  The coffee is good, too.  The people who work here are always nice and friendly.

data.title: Great food and inviting staff!
data.text: I will often meet here with friends for Breakfast. I love the food, coffee, and of course the welcoming staff. The restaurant is open with small and large tables. The Umu Pork is so good! It's smoked outside, next to the building!! My favorite is the Breakfast Burrito or the Breakfast bowl with the pork! Yum, so good!

data.title: Easy and comfortable
data.text: Clean, open space, great Longbottom coffee and outstanding homemade cookies.  Very pleasant surprise on my first visit.  Nice change from the big guy's place down the street.

data.title: Family owned....island influence...appetite friendly
data.text: Manaia is a family owned cafe, literally, they brought mom back from the island to cook...and her recipes are WORTH a trip to HER!  The service is amazing, and the food is awesome.  You can over-order so easily as the portions  are very filling.  The pork is A M A Z I N G and breakfast--well it's one of the best in town.  If you haven't tried it, you should!

data.title: Downtown YUM!!
data.text: We've eaten here a handful of times on Tuesday Market nights.  The food is always fresh and sizes are good!  We pick Manaia over all the other food vendors for that reason.  Everyone is very friendly and it's just a fun place to stop for a quick bite.  We've had the coffee and that too is very good!

data.title: Umma acai bowl
data.text: Met a friend for coffee here and tried one of the acai bowls, which was wonderful. Can't wait to go back.

data.title: hillsboro eats
data.text: looking for a little island flavor - they provide delicious chicken and their potato salad is so yummy

data.title: Decent Food and Coffee, Average Service and Ambiance
data.text:
My son took me to breakfast here while we were getting his car serviced. The food and coffee were good. I had the veggie breakfast burrito and my son had Umu breakfast burrito and we both thought they were good. 

Maybe they were having a bad day, but none of the staff seemed that happy to be there and seemed a bit standoffish. Also I think they could do a bit more with the interior, and it may sound snobbish but I don't think a big screen TV blaring the news is appropriate for a coffee shop. 

Given the choice I'd say go to Insomnia Coffee if you want a local coffee shop.

data.title: Always good....and different!
data.text:
I get tired of Thai which we have an overabundance of in Hillsboro.  Manaia has good island meats with great sides.  The breakfasts are to DIE for....and the folks who own it are very nice.  

There are often art events there, and you can tell the food is cooked with love and Island experience.  Eating there is almost like a mini vacation!

data.title: Good coffee, nice folks
data.text:
Rating = Go

This is a nice little coffee joint in downtown Hillsboro. They serve some good coffee and have an assortment of baked goods. 

The owners are Samoan and serve food influenced by their native land. It is very similar to Hawaiian food. Very good and a little bit different than other coffee houses. 

This place is definitely worth checking out.

data.title: Great food
data.text: We stopped by for a quick breakfast on a Monday morning. I had vegetarian  croissant and hubby had the pork breakfast burrito. this is an order at the counter and pick it up when your name is called kind of place. the coffee was fantastic. the burrito was huge and my husband really enjoyed it. My croissant was really good as well. nicely decorated establishment right in downtown. We had no trouble finding street parking right in front. limited food selection but if you're looking for a sandwich or a quick breakfast that is not fast food this is the place.

data.title: Great breakfast and coffee.
data.text: We went there for the breakfast buriittos and they were wonderful.  The coffee was great, I had a blended hot coffee, can't remember the name but loved it.  My husband goes back there 3-4's a month.

data.title: Nice space
data.text:
Stopped in for coffee after visiting the municipal area. Quiet, Jamaican background music playing Within a woody interior. Wall & shelf art displays add to the comfy ambience. 
My companion enjoyed the foam of his otherwise wonderfully dry cappuccino.  My mocha could have been stronger in roasted coffee flavor. 
We didn't try the lunch selections. Perhaps another time. Nice space in a lovely community.

data.title: What a great new place!
data.text:
Super nice folks who obviously take a lot of pride in what they do. We loved everything we had. We shared a plate of the pork and chicken with Mac salad. Huge portions and super tasty!

We took some pineapple cake home which was amazing too.

Also loved the island reggae music!

\nnn/

data.title: Amazing, delicious, well thought out, etc...
data.text: The service is fantastic and the food is amazing. The barista is also very well trained, pulled all her shots perfectly and mixed everything spot on. The atmosphere is cozy with plenty of room for everyone. Overall very nice place, I will be back on a regular basis.

data.title: Tasty and relaxing family-run cafe
data.text: Had our first visit today to newly opened Manaia for a late lunch. Very friendly, accommodating family-run place and has good-vibes as a relaxed place to hang out. They specialize in Samoan-type food for lunch (which reminds us of Hawaiian plate lunches), which the Samoan mom of one of the owners cooks. They also use lots of organic ingredients and offers gluten-free options.  They also do great espressos/lattes, offering suger-free and dairy-free options as well.  We ate excellent uma pork, fresh spinach salad with fresh strawberries and pineapple, and Mama's own potato salad.  Sizeable helpings and reasonable prices.  Co-owner, Danny came out and introduced himself and checked on how we were liking our food. He and his wife Jessica (bustling and smiling behind the counter) seem to be a very personable young couple. As a coffee house/food place, Manaia does not duplicate what's already in historic downtown Hillsboro and will be a great addition to it!  In the afternoon when we were there, there were some families with small children hanging out in the back half of the restaurant where there were sofas and a big screen tv., and my husband and I were comfortable at a small table in the front part of the coffeehouse where we couldn't even hear the tv.  It's definitely a family friendly place, yet it is a large enough space that people seeking a little quiet with their coffee should also easily be able to find it.  We're glad Manaia is off to such a great start, and we will definitely be back soon to try breakfast (menu had options from organic oatmeal to organic breakfast burritos) or for late night coffee/dessert.
